content.raw:
I copied your urdf into a file called parallel.urdf and did `gzsdf print parallel.urdf > parallel.sdf`. Here is a subset of the sdf:
~~~
$ grep -A2 '<joint' parallel.sdf
    <joint name='LegL' type='revolute'>
      <child>LegL</child>
      <parent>base_link</parent>
--
    <joint name='TracksLL' type='revolute'>
      <child>TracksLeft</child>
      <parent>LegL0</parent>
--
    <joint name='legl0' type='revolute'>
      <child>LegL0</child>
      <parent>base_link</parent>
--
    <joint name='TracksLL' type='revolute'>
      <child>TracksLeft</child>
      <parent>LegL0</parent>
~~~
As you can see, the TracksLL joint is repeated two times, and the TracksL joint is not included at all. I believe this is based on the hierarchical data structure in urdf that does not allow for loops. There is a workaround using `<gazebo>` tags, but I haven't implemented it yet.

As an alternative example, I believe the [pr2_gripper in gazebo_models](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/68989fe22ddc430909763eace37d45a4a4936e25/pr2_gripper/model.sdf?at=default) has a parallel mechanism, though it is expressed in sdf rather than urdf.
content.html:
I copied your urdf into a file called parallel.urdf and did gzsdf print parallel.urdf > parallel.sdf. Here is a subset of the sdf:

$ grep -A2 '<joint' parallel.sdf
    <joint name='LegL' type='revolute'>
      <child>LegL</child>
      <parent>base_link</parent>
--
    <joint name='TracksLL' type='revolute'>
      <child>TracksLeft</child>
      <parent>LegL0</parent>
--
    <joint name='legl0' type='revolute'>
      <child>LegL0</child>
      <parent>base_link</parent>
--
    <joint name='TracksLL' type='revolute'>
      <child>TracksLeft</child>
      <parent>LegL0</parent>

As you can see, the TracksLL joint is repeated two times, and the TracksL joint is not included at all. I believe this is based on the hierarchical data structure in urdf that does not allow for loops. There is a workaround using <gazebo> tags, but I haven't implemented it yet.

As an alternative example, I believe the pr2_gripper in gazebo_models has a parallel mechanism, though it is expressed in sdf rather than urdf.
